README.md:
pybib
=====

Parse a BibTeX file, tidily rewrite its entries, with common authors grouped together, check for errors and check against LaTeX document.
You can even fetch missing BibTeX items from HEP-INSPIRE.

install
=====
Nothing to do!

running
====
```
user@computer:~$ python bibtex.py 
Usage: bibtex.py [options]

Parse a BibTeX file.

Options:
  --version             show program's version number and exit
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -a example.aux, --aux=example.aux
                        auxilliary LaTeX file
  -w, --warn            print warning messages
  -i, --inspire         retrieve items from INSPIRE-HEP
  -u, --url             add an INSPIRE-HEP and arXiv URL
  -r, --reformat        reformat bibliography

```
For example, if I have an auxilliary LaTeX file and I desire warnings and that
it retrieves missing BibTeX items from HEP-SPIRES:
```
user@computer:~$ python bibtex.py -wi -a example.aux bibtex.bib
```

For example, suppose I wish to tidy:
```
@article{Aad:2009wy,
    author = "Aad, G. and others",
    title = "{Expected Performance of the ATLAS Experiment - Detector, Trigger and Physics}",
    collaboration = "ATLAS Collaboration",
    year = "2009",
    eprint = "0901.0512",
    archiveprefix = "arXiv",
    primaryclass = "hep-ex",
    reportnumber = "SLAC-R-980, CERN-OPEN-2008-020",
    slaccitation = "%%CITATION = ARXIV:0901.0512;%%",
}

@article{Aad:2012fqa,
    author = "Aad, Georges and others",
    title = "{Search for squarks and gluinos with the ATLAS detector in final states with jets and missing transverse momentum using $4.7 fb^{-1}$ of $\sqrt{s}=7$ TeV proton-proton collision data}",
    collaboration = "ATLAS Collaboration",
    journal = "Phys.Rev.",
    volume = "D87",
    pages = "012008",
    doi = "10.1103/PhysRevD.87.012008",
    year = "2013",
    eprint = "1208.0949",
    archiveprefix = "arXiv",
    primaryclass = "hep-ex",
    reportnumber = "CERN-PH-EP-2012-195",
    slaccitation = "%%CITATION = ARXIV:1208.0949;%%",
}
```
I run 
```
user@computer:~$ python bibtex.py -wu bibtex.bib
```
Then it will notice that they are both by the ATLAS collaboration and sort them,
issue warning messages, and make hyperlinks to HEP-INSPIRE and the arXiv:
```
# Unused BibTeX item: Aad:2009wy
# Unused BibTeX item: Aad:2012fqa
################################################################################
# ATLAS Collaboration. 2 keys: Aad:2009wy,Aad:2012fqa
################################################################################
# \cite{Aad:2009wy}
# Possible duplicate BibTeX items: []
# Number of citations: 0
# Citation number in LaTeX document: None
@article{Aad:2009wy,
    author = {\href{http://inspirehep.net/search?p=find+texkey+Aad%3A2009wy&rg=100&jrec=0&ln=en&of=hb&action_search=Search}{Aad, G. and others}},
    title = {Expected Performance of the ATLAS Experiment - Detector, Trigger and Physics},
    collaboration = {ATLAS Collaboration},
    year = {2009},
    eprint = {\href{http://arxiv.org/abs/0901.0512}{arXiv:0901.0512}},
    archiveprefix = {arXiv},
    primaryclass = {hep-ex},
    reportnumber = {SLAC-R-980, CERN-OPEN-2008-020},
    slaccitation = {%%CITATION = ARXIV:0901.0512;%%},
    inspire = {http://inspirehep.net/search?p=find+texkey+Aad%3A2009wy&rg=100&jrec=0&ln=en&of=hb&action_search=Search},
    arxiv = {http://arxiv.org/abs/0901.0512},
}

# \cite{Aad:2012fqa}
```
